channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Explained: How Russia played a key role in the Liberation of Goa
Is Shehbaz Sharif coming up in the way of Asim Munir’s elevation to military chief?
Alaknanda: How Indian astronomers found a Milky Way-like galaxy
In Graphics | How Russia remains India’s top defence supplier
The case of Sunali Khatun: Why pregnant woman deported to Bangladesh is now allowed to return to India
Meet Laurent Simons, the ‘Little Einstein’ who has completed his PhD in quantum physics at 15
Imran Khan is not dead, and neither is Pakistan’s ‘House of Cards’ politics
item.description: Pakistan is again living through its own ‘House of Cards’ moment. Imran Khan, who once was the country’s most visible, loudest, and most defiantly public political figure, now exists in Pakistan’s political imagination more as a contested idea than as a tangible presence

item.title: Teesta project: How Chinese involvement raises India’s eastern security concerns
item.description: Bangladesh’s invitation to China for the Teesta project alters more than a riverbank. It reshapes the security calculus of eastern India

item.title: Head-on | White Christian nationalism can return America to its Third World roots
item.description: For a nation founded on massacres of Native Americans and centuries-long African slave ownership, the lurch towards racism under Trump is not surprising

item.title: Trump’s Azerbaijan-Armenia ‘peace deal’ won’t hold: Why the Caucasus needs Indian peacekeepers now
item.description: Taking charge of a peace mission in the Caucasus would promote peace more than Donald Trump’s empty ceremonies, bolster India’s diplomatic influence, and further cement its markets as its influence grows in Armenia

item.title: Wabi-Sabi is the internet’s new favourite trend. But do we really understand it?
item.description: Wabi-sabi, rooted in Japanese culture, has gone viral online as people embrace imperfect beauty in daily life, inspired by King of the Hill and a shift away from perfection culture.

item.title: Putin in Delhi: How the India-Russia reset could reshape global geopolitics
item.description: The India-Russia relationship today isn’t simply a replay of the Soviet-era script. It is leaner, less sentimental and far more transactional and also sturdier than most expected.
